author: Samyak Jain
title: Test1
content:
\# Welcome to the Ultimate Test Post üöÄ



This post is meant to \*\*test all features\*\* supported by our blog setup using Decap CMS and MDX.



\## Markdown Features



\### Headings



\- H1: \`# Heading\`

\- H2: \`## Heading\`

\- H3: \`### Heading\`



\### Text Formatting



\- \*Italic\*

\- \*\*Bold\*\*

\- \~\~Strikethrough\~\~



\### Blockquote



\> ‚ÄúDecap CMS makes content editing \_so\_ easy!‚Äù ‚Äî Happy Editor



\### Links



\[Visit OpenAI](https://openai.com)



\### Lists



\#### Unordered List



\- First item

\- Second item

\- Nested item

\- Third item



\#### Ordered List



1. First step

2. Second step

3. Third step



\### Images



!\[Decap CMS Logo](/images/decap-logo.png)



\### Tables



\| Feature     | Supported | Notes                      |

\|-------------|-----------|----------------------------|

\| Markdown    | ‚úÖ        | All the basics are covered |

\| MDX         | ‚úÖ        | Works with JSX             |

\| Code blocks | ‚úÖ        | Syntax highlighting ready  |



\## Code Blocks



\### JavaScript Example



\`\``js

function greet(name) {

  console.log(\`Hello, ${name}!\`);

}

greet("Decap");

\`\`\`\`



\### Python Example



\`\``python

def greet(name):

\    print(f"Hello, {name}!")

greet("Decap")

\`\``



\## JSX/MDX Components



You can embed React components too:



<Alert type="info" title="Heads up!">

  This is a custom alert component rendered inside MDX!

</Alert>





\## Conclusion



If you're seeing this post rendered correctly, \*\*your MDX blog setup is working perfectly!\*\* üéâ



Happy blogging! üìù



\`\``



Let me know if you want to include dynamic imports, environment-based rendering, or any additional CMS-specific fields like tags or related posts.

\`\``
